inputs.selection_motivation: The Brent‑to‑WTI link is the least evidence‑supported and most redundant, as Brent already serves as the global oil benchmark; removing it preserves core pillar coverage while freeing capacity for the new long‑term rate link.

prioritized_link.motivation: Brent price movements shape long‑term inflation expectations, which directly drive the 30‑year Treasury yield curve; thus Brent should be linked to ust30y.
